sections.content: Bucks Run 2.5 km ski trail will be groomed for skate and classic skiing today, February 20, 2025 . There is an additional $5 daily trail fee for the use of Bucks Run or annual permits are available for $125.  Dogs and walkers are not permitted on our groomed trails. No trails on the golf course.

sections.header: Natural Snow Classic and Skate Ski Trails
sections.content: –  For today, February 20, 2025 grooming for classic ski and skate ski will take place on Coyote Run and Hawks Hill while Cedar Trace will be groomed for classic skiing.

sections.header: Stony Creek Cross Country Ski Rental:
sections.content: Ski center will be open on 2/22 and 2/23.  Golf course and Shelden Trails are currently groomed.  Ski rentals can be booked ahead https://www.metroparks.com/stony-creek-metropark/#cross-country_skiing.

Nubs Nob (Harbor Springs).conditions: World class conditions persist. Entire system was powertilled and tracked again this AM. Huge thanks to the crew at Nubs!

Huron Meadows Metropark (Brighton).conditions: Skated on Coyote Run this afternoon. I stayed on the loop behind Buck’s Run, which was near perfect and, unlike the golf course, the trails were not wind blown because it’s in the woods. Classic tracks looked great also. OK to use A skis. Big thanks to the HM staff for keeping us skiing!

nubsNob.liftsOpen: At least 5 lifts, Rope Tow, and the Space Worm
nubsNob.xcTrails: Trails are open and in great shape. Trails will be power-tilled with a track set again this morning.
nubsNob.nightSkiing: Tuesday through Saturday from 5:30 to 9:00 PM.
nubsNob.comments: It is a perfect mid-winter ski day with over an inch of fresh snow this morning. The snow continues to fall lightly and is sitting on top of the corduroy. Conditions continue to be extremely good. The temperature will also make its way into the 20's today which should feel warm after the cold snap we have been experiencing. The lifts will spin from 9 AM to 9 PM today with an hour break at 4:30 PM to prepare for night skiing. Make it a great day at Nub's Nob.
